H0.text: Antioxidants are health‑promoting molecules that inhibit the oxidation of other molecules.

H1.text: Neurotransmitters are health‑promoting molecules that inhibit the oxidation of other molecules.

H2.text: Nutrients are health‑promoting molecules that inhibit the oxidation of other molecules.

H3.text: Hormones are health‑promoting molecules that inhibit the oxidation of other molecules.

A4.text: In cells, antioxidants such as glutathione, mycothiol, or bacillithiol, and enzyme systems like superoxide dismutase, inhibit damage from oxidative stress.

A5.text: Polyphenols, which have antioxidant properties in vitro due to their free hydroxy groups, are extensively metabolized by catechol-O-methyltransferase which methylates free hydroxyl groups, and thereby prevents them from acting as antioxidants in vivo.
